project.teaser: WinWin4Worklife envisions to enable healthy, inclusive and sustainable remote working arrangements (RWA) in Europe by combining employer and employee perspectives into a single framework. The project has five key objectives and outcomes:1) To gain an interdisciplinary...
project.title: Healthy, inclusive and sustainable remote work futures as a Win-Win for employees and employers in urban, rural and cross-border areas
project.keywords: Future of work, Spatial and social inequalities, Cross-border, Well-being, Mixed-methods, Smartphone-based data collection, Forecasting

programme.title: Remote working arrangements and their economic, social and spatial effects

category.title: Topic

result.title: General EC Policy Briefs
result.description: Three general EC Policy Briefs will be published which integrate findings about the economic, social and spatial impacts of RWA from the WP-based policy briefs. A first version will be submitted by M15 and then re-submitted by M30 and M42

result.title: Report on state-of-the-art, research gaps and conceptual diagram
result.description: Systematic review of the literature on social, economic and spatial impacts of different types of remote work, i.e. working from home, working in satellite office and digital nomad work. The review will distinguish between lessons learned from the past (before COVID-19), the current state-of-play (during the pandemic) and future scenarios (post-pandemic).

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - WinWin4WorkLife (Healthy, inclusive and sustainable remote work futures as a Win-Win for employees and employers in urban, rural and cross-border areas)
result.teaser: The WinWin4WorkLife project explores how remote work is changing the way we live and work — and how Europe can harness this shift. Since the COVID-19 pandemic, working from home or outside the traditional office has become a normal part of life for many. While remote work...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Project handbook
result.description: The project handbook will include: (i) a Project Management Plan, (ii) a Gender Policy, (iii) Quality Management Plan, and (iv) a Risk Assessment Plan.The Project Management Plan will include tools developed by EQY that facilitate know-how exchanges and collaborative work between partners. It also includes financial management tools, as well as management templates to collect administrative information, establish cost statements (timesheets, financial tables) and evaluate project progress (advancement indicators).A Gender Policy will be developed by LISER (with support of all WP leaders) to ensure specific provisions and consideration are in place during relevant project activities across WP1-WP3. A Quality Management Plan will be developed by LISER (with support of all WP leaders) defining the quality procedures to be used throughout the project. A Risk Assessment Plan will be developed by LISER (with support of all WP leaders) identifying potential deviations or setbacks during the project execution and preparing contingency plans to mitigate risks and address them with recovery actions, whenever needed.

result.title: WinWin4WorkLife impacts and sustainability report
result.description: Report summarizing the impact of the WinWin4WorkLife project taken into account different target audiences. Moreover, the report will set out the exploitation strategy to spread the outputs and results of the WinWin4WorkLife project after the end of the project. A first version of the report will be submitted by M15 and then re-submitted by M30 and M42.

result.title: Ethics and security management report
result.description: Hbits will define specific ethics guidelines to be followed by the consortium partners, and support project partners in fulfulling ethics requirements. Hbits will regularly report on these activities in the Ethics and Security Management reports (M15, M30, M42).

result.title: Lexicon on remote work
result.description: Lexicon of 'remote work', thereby focussing on various types of remote work in particular working-from-home, working in satellite office and digital nomad work. The lexicon provides an overview of (i) the definitions used in academic literatures, (ii) how 'remote work' is operationalized and measured in surveys, and (iii) how it is used in EU and national remote work regulations.

result.title: Implementation plan for data collection
result.description: The implementation plan for data collection sets out target groups, sampling procedures, the communication strategy to engage employers and employees (in Finland, Germany, Luxembourg, Portugal, Slovakia). Attention will also be paid to ethics, privacy and GDPR. Moreover, the plan sets out general principles for the employer and employee survey as well as the opt-in survey on digital nomads (in Portugal).

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: A first version will be submitted by M6 and re-submitted by M15, M30 and M42.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
